story.title: The Christmas Sweater - Episode 3
story.storyDescription: Ever since her mother‚Äôs death, Noelle hasn‚Äôt wanted to go home for the holidays. But perhaps a bit of holiday magic is all she needs‚Ä¶
story.creator: web-uploader
story.prePaywallNotification: Did Noelle just let a chance at love slip away? Keep reading THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER üéÑ‚ù§Ô∏è
story.postPaywallNotification: Who is the hot guy sitting with Maria, and what other secret are Noelle‚Äôs family hiding from her? Keep reading THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER to find out üéÖüéÑ

messages.text: Noelle knocks on the door five times ‚Äî her family‚Äôs secret code.
No answer.
She‚Äôs standing at the side entrance of her childhood home‚Äî
A charming 19th century craftsman bungalow tucked into a cozy street in Portsmouth, New Hampshire.
A festive wreath hangs on the door.
She smiles a little, and then unlocks the mudroom door with her key.
She hasn‚Äôt used this side entrance in years.
But it feels like it‚Äôd be more of an insult to ring the front doorbell like a guest.
Hello‚Ä¶? I‚Äôm home!
No one responds, so Noelle locks the door behind her.
Her dad must be out running errands, and Maria must be at her apartment.
Noelle heads toward the stairwell to put down her belongings.
After what seemed like an endless flight and a flustering encounter with that guy‚Ä¶
Her focus is on one thing‚Äî
Getting a nice, hot shower, followed by a good night‚Äôs sleep.
But then, out of the corner of her eye‚Ä¶
She sees something moving in the den.
Someone must have come home.
Excited to see her family, she hurries into the cozy back room‚Ä¶
Only to find her Dad locked in a passionate embrace, with Beatrice.
Oh my god!
Oh!
Noelle‚Äôs dad disentangles himself from Beatrice‚Äôs arms.
Hi sweetheart. I uh ‚Äî I didn‚Äôt know you‚Äôd be home so early.
There wasn‚Äôt any traffic between Boston and New Hampshire, for the first time ever.
But now I‚Äôm kinda wishing there was‚Ä¶
Beatrice‚Äôs eyes tear up at Noelle‚Äôs cutting words. She looks down at her feet.
The familiar twang of regret slices through Noelle.
Why does she always turn into a total Grinch around the holidays?
Noelle‚Ä¶I really don‚Äôt like the tone you use around Beatrice.
Look, I don‚Äôt want to fight.
Noelle looks at her dad with pleading eyes.
It‚Äôs been a long day. I think I just need a shower and some sleep.
Can we‚Ä¶have this conversation tomorrow?
I don‚Äôt want to say something I‚Äôll regret.
There‚Äôs an awkward silence before Noelle‚Äôs dad sighs.
Whatever you want, honey. We‚Äôre just happy you‚Äôre home.
Noelle opens her mouth with a quick-witted insult ripe on her tongue‚Äî
But then thinks better of it.
What did Maria say?
It‚Äôs Christmastime. Noelle should try and have a heart.
She heads upstairs for a shower and a restless night of sleep.
The next day
Noelle comes down to the kitchen to find three people sitting at the table, laughing together and sipping mugs of hot coffee.
It‚Äôs her Dad, her sister Maria, and a cute guy Noelle has never seen before.
And he‚Äôs sitting very close to Maria.
He‚Äôs dressed in soft flannel and has the sweetest, clearest blue eyes.
Noelle, I‚Äôm so glad you‚Äôre home!
Maria gets up and wraps her older sister in a big hug.
Then she takes a step back, pointing to the burly, bearded guy beside her.
I want to introduce you to someone.
Noelle freezes.
Is her little sister in a serious relationship?
And‚Ä¶with a guy that looks exactly like Chris Pratt?!
FML
Not hearing her, Maria grabs Noelle‚Äôs hand and leads her excitedly over to the table.
This is my boyfriend Tom. We met at med school!
In a daze, Noelle moves to stick out her hand, but Tom wraps her in a big hug.
Noelle huffs.
She‚Äôs so not ready for a hug-fest first thing in the morning.
Tom starts rattling off questions to Noelle, but she‚Äôs too zonked to answer.
Maria playfully slaps her boyfriend‚Äôs arm.
Tom! Stooop ‚Äî let her have her coffee first.
Letting out a chuckle, Tom apologizes.
He proceeds to tickle Maria, who in turn starts screeching with joy.
Noelle‚Äôs dad looks on lovingly at his youngest daughter.
A smile brightens his face.
And though Noelle knows that the scene should fill her with happiness too‚Ä¶
She can‚Äôt help but feel her chest squeeze uncomfortably.
Maria grasps her sister‚Äôs hand again, pulling her out of her funk.
All right, time for a sister bonding sesh!
Tom stands up instantly, understanding that he must make himself scarce.
He kisses Maria on the top of her head and shows himself out of the house.
In the meantime, Noelle turns to her dad.
Apparently I‚Äôm going to be a third wheel this entire Christmas season, huh?
No Beatrice today?
Noelle! Don‚Äôt say her name like that!
Like what? How‚Äôd I say it?
Like she was something you stepped in‚Äî
Now, girls!
The sisters stop bickering the moment they hear their father‚Äôs voice.
When they turn to look at him, he looks very tired.
Beatrice had to man the shop today.
And to be honest, Noelle‚Ä¶
She was feeling a little uncomfortable in our home.
And I think that was because of the way you spoke to her, sweetheart.
I‚Äî
Please let me finish.
There‚Äôs something I need to tell you.
There‚Äôs a beat of silence.
Noelle can feel the tension in the air.
Why does it seem like everyone knows something she doesn‚Äôt?
The reason your sister was really pushing for you to come home this year‚Ä¶
Wasn‚Äôt JUST because she thought it‚Äôd be nice for all of us to celebrate the holidays together.
It‚Äôs not?
No. There‚Äôs‚Ä¶actually something else we‚Äôre going to celebrate this year.
Noelle, I‚Äôm getting remarried on Christmas.
